metadata.name: New Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of netsh commands that configure a new port forwarding (PortProxy) rule

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('interface')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('portproxy')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('add')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('v4tov4')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('i ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('p ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('a ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('v ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('connectp')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('listena')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c='))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of netsh commands that configure a new port forwarding (PortProxy) rule

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate administration activity 2. WSL2 network bridge PowerShell script used for WSL/Kubernetes/Docker (e.g. https://github.com/microsoft/WSL/issues/4150#issuecomment-504209723) References: https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2019/01/bypassing-network-restrictions-through-rdp-tunneling.html, https://adepts.of0x.cc/netsh-portproxy-code/, https://www.dfirnotes.net/portproxy_detection/
